item.description:
Crowns is an abstract strategy board game, like chess, go, or stratego. Crowns is what you’d get if you tried to cram a wargame into a chess board.

Players select their starting pieces from 3 tiers of units and sets up behind a divider. After both players have set up, the divider is removed and the game is played with perfect information.

The goal of the game is to capture the opponent's crown -- a piece analogous to the king in chess, but unable to capture.

Each player selects 8 bottom-tier units, 4 mid-tier units, and 1 top-tier unit, for a total of 14 pieces including the crown. All pieces have movement limitations and most have special rules including shooting and continuing to move after capturing.

Crowns is played on a 9x9 grid; each player has 3 home rows and there are three rows of no-man's-land. It has a historical military theme: units include archers, cavalry and men-at-arms.

item.description:
This is a dice game in Onsworld's Jackpot Dice series.
The game comes with five special dice that show an Ace, deuce, four, eight ten and Jack. There are also cards showing each of these denominations and four cards showing pay-offs.

A player takes on the role of banker and hands a die to another player to cast. After rolling the first die, that player decides how much to bet and subsequently decides whether to roll more dice, one by one, attempting to come as close to a total of twenty-one but not exceeding it. If he exceeds twenty-one the banker takes the player's stake, but if he stops below twenty-one, the banker then rolls two dice and attempts to beat or equal the player's roll. If the banker fails to equal the roll or goes bust, the player wins the appropriate amount as indicated on the cards.

Optionally, the players may play with side bets. For this purpose, the other cards showing card faces are laid out and players may bet on these faces appearing on the dice for each roll of the dice.

The instructions mention that other games in the Jackpot Dice series include Clipper, Crown and Anchor, Liar and Crossword Dice.

Throw the die and be the first to fill your rug with a complete set of picnic items.

Each player takes it in turn to throw the die. If you throw a six, you take a rug; if you throw any other number before getting your picnic rug you pass. Once you have your picnic rug, you take the other pieces as follows. When you throw:
One - a bottle of pop
Two - a sandwich 
Three - a piece of cake
Four - an apple
Five - sausage roll
Six - pass

If you throw a number you do not need, for example, two, when you already have a sandwich, then you must pass. The first player to complete their rug and make the Perfect Picnic wins the game.

Similar to Jumbolino and Cootie

Publisher information

The world is full of perfect havens for insurgents. They hide in the jungles, mountains, and even the cities.OPFOR Insurgency is third in the companies "10 Minute War Game" series and includes the Jungle, Mountain, and City editions. 
 
As the Blufor (US) you have intelligence units, air and artillery support, and your allies to help find and destroy a High Value Target (HVT) before it disappears.
 
As the OPFOR you have the advantage of restricted terrain, IEDs, ambushes, and engineering obstacles to delay or destroy units searching for you. 
 
To play, the OPFOR places cards,including the HVT, facedown in a 5X5 pattern. The Blufor has 3 turns of 3 moves to uncover the hidden OPFOR cards, find and destroy the HVT with his units.

The game was designed by Steve Pearson, a member of the World Class OPFOR, Ft. Leavenworth, Kansas.

In Zombie Tide: Road to Hope, players must explore a ruined city, scavenging fuel, food, ammo, and equipment in an attempt to survive roaming zombie hordes and arrive safely at the Military Base where rescue awaits.

Cash in fuel chips to move, spend ammo to fend off zombies, and collect equipment to bolster your attacks and defenses.

Running out of food, ammo, or fuel could be disastrous, as infection sets in, leading to madness and eventual transformation into a zombie!

Sbronzopoli (where "sbronza" means to get plastered) is an alcoholic roll-and-move party game for adults, inspired by Monopoly. Here you move your pawn towards the goal, drinking at almost each step of your path.

item.description:
2012: The Day of Fallout - Commander
Free, tactical board game for 2 players (print and play)

Lead one of two armies: Human Section 8 and Arkanian alien race. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section 8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- draw to 3 cards on hand
- recruit units
- realize special missions
- move units on board
- attack
- Victory Points counting

Victory is achieved by:
- collecting victory point's
- destruction of all enemy unit's on board
- winning three of the four opponent fields (starting field's)

Game in Polish and English language version.

Two teams compete to solve enigmas writen upon cards. The less clues you use, the more points you score. A magnifying glass serves to reveal the anwers as well as a scoring pad.

Contents:
- A book of rules
- A big magnifying glass 
- 75 cards printed on both sides (for a total of 150 enigmas to solve)

Outnumbered is a question and answer game that requires quick thinking and a little bit of luck!

What year did the Berlin Wall come down? Number of Van Gogh’s ears? Not only do you have to be the first person to answer the question correctly but you must have the dice to match! Players take turns reading and answering questions. Each player rolls their own set of dice using the numbers rolled to answer the questions. Correctly answered questions earn points; some are harder and award more points than others. Be the player with the most points to win!

With 750 questions and 60 dice

(from Manufacturer's site)

Ninjas prepare to be challenged! The Golden Dragon has been discovered and you must be the first to reach its location. To reach the ancient artifact, each ninja will have to travel through four areas: a bamboo forest, an ancient Japanese village, the cave of elders and a koi pond. To move throughout these locations, ninja players roll one of two sets of dice and solve the number challenge rolled.

The skill level of each player determines which set of dice that ninja will use the basic set of dice includes addition and subtraction; the advanced set of dice includes addition, subtraction and multiplication. In each of the four locations, ninjas will solve a word challenge, once all four challenges have been successfully completed, the ninja player makes his way to the Golden Dragon and the win!

But don’t be fooled, the life of a ninja is never as easy as it looks, while moving throughout the lands other ninjas will try to trap you and block your way to the Golden Dragon, you must defend yourself while using your smarts and turn the traps on them!

The box includes: 3 Ninja Recruit dice, 3 ninja master dice, game board, 4 ninja pawns, 12 quest items, 3 traps, the Golden Dragon, 80 ninja challenge cards, and EASY to follow rules!

Choose your Action! Princess and get ready for an exciting adventure as you rescue Prince Simpleton!

On your way to save the Prince, you must conquer the Forest of Spelling, the Bog of Numbers, Triviaville, the Ancient Maze, and the action-packed Action Cave!

Action! Princesses features word and number play, trivia for girls, physical challenges, a dry-erase game board, and a TON OF DICE!

What's in the box?
8 letter dice, 5 spot dice, 1 JUMBO die, 3 number dice, Game Board, Four Princess Pawns, Dry Erase Marker, 40 Action Cave cards, 40 Triviaville cards, 50 Story cards,
and EASY-TO-FOLLOW rules!

(from Manufacturer's Site)

After 3000 years of restless retirement, batty old elf Willy McWindup is suddenly called in to perform Head Elf duties amidst a wild case of snowball fever sending all of Santa's remaining Head Elves to bed rest. With mere days before Christmas Eve and piles of presents yet to construct, you must reign in old Willy's outrageous ideas and convince him to green light and produce your concepts to help save christmas.


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a quick family holiday themed card game for 2-6 Players, the more the merrier! It plays similar to Apples to Apples, using funny and disgusting combinations of IDEA and CONCEPT Cards, which together represent a finished present yet to be constructed. Taking turns playing the Head Elf, you draw an IDEA card and (reading aloud) present it on the table. Helper Elves (the remaining players) then choose a CONCEPT card that they feel best matches the IDEA card. Receiving the cards face down, the Head Elf then shuffles and (reading aloud) presents the CONCEPTS on the table. Using ANY criteria, the Head Elf then chooses which Combination of IDEA and CONCEPT to green light and send to production - thus scoring one point towards the win for the player whose CONCEPT was chosen. Roles then rotate around the table until there is a winner with the most CONCEPTS chosen (rules vary based on number of players). 


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a Free Print and Play designed by Monster Make.

108 Cards, all files provided in High Resolution, including Rules and Tuck Box.

Currently files can be found HERE.

It is a large file (240MB) consisting of 14 pages of 8.5x11 (Letter) Cards with 9 cards to a page. It also contains 1 page of 8.5x11 PocketMod layout Rules, and 2 pages of 8.5x14 (Legal) Tuckbox layouts. 
 The files will eventually be loaded into the Database, but for now can be found at the above link!

Included is alternate rules for 2 players with the addition of A,B,C cards and a version for young (3+ years) players.


Thanks, hope you enjoy!!
Stephen - Monster Make

Finnish children's character Rölli and his friends walk in the Rölli forest, trying to stay in the forest as long as possible.

Players roll dice and move their characters accordingly, gaining action cards. The cards help characters to stay in the forest longer. The winner is the last character still in the forest.

Actions in the cards: 5 steps back, 10 steps back, roll dice to step back, stop current move, everyone else roll dice to move forward.

item.description:
Welcome to Skreemer, a game of future hovercar racing for 2 - 10 players. 
The game is based on the popular Wipeout computer games, and has tight bends, speed-up’s and of course....missiles to slow down your opponents.

The simple rule set allows players hovercars to use a speedometer to accelerate round the track. Moving over speed-ups will propel you forward. Moving over weapon pods will equip your car with rockets to slow your opponents down. Hits are calculated on a very simple dice throw. The winner is the player to cross the chequered flag after the final lap.

To set up Findevier, lay out the ten double-sided animal discs in a circle. Shuffle the deck of cards, place them in the circle, then reveal the top card, thereby showing the animal that players will search for in the first round. Place 1-4 tokens in the circle to account for the animals of this type that aren't visible. (Two cards show woodland elves instead of an animal, and the plaeyr who draws this card chooses which animal players will search for.)

On a turn, a player flips over one of the discs to reveal the animal shown on the other side. If the player reveals the target animal, she earns one token from the circle; if the player reveals the fourth animal of this type, the player takes the final token, along with the animal card. Once all four animals of the desired type are visible, reveal the next card. Once all twelve cards have been used, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. Each token and animal card is worth one point, while the two elf cards are worth two points each.

Game play in Taiga is nearly identical to that of Findevier, with the differences being (1) that the game has only ten animal cards and no elf cards; (2) that a player who reveals an incorrect animal must return a token to the bank; and (3) that each token is worth one point and each animal card is worth two points.

It's that time of year! The air has gotten crisp and the elves are working overtime to ensure Santa's sleigh is ready to go on the big night! And boy have there been a lot of orders this year! From iPlods to Zebras (with Real Exploding Action), children's wish lists have gotten increasingly lengthy and complex!

This year, the big cheese himself has decided to bring in some migrant elves to help with demand. He even gave them their own factory floors and access to the common area! Needless to say, The pointy eared members of Christmas local #127 have become fearful of replacement if they fall behind on this year's manufacturing.

In Christmas spirit, players take control of one of the groups of elves competing to create toys for Santa's winter ride. The object of the game is to create more, better toys than the rival groups. The player with the most victory points in toy cards in Santa's sleigh at the end of the game is the winner and has a little job security for next year.

From back of the box

Dice trowing for the highest eyes! Mex is the highest score you can get and is the combination of a 2 and a 1. all other values are between 32 and 600. players with the lower scores get punished and eventually eliminated. but with bluffing you can avoid an exile; you trow the dice and hold the dice hidden under the cup. you claim a high score and hope that the next player won't get you. it all depends on your bluffing skills! the best dice thrower and bluffer will be the winner at the end.

Try to land any part of your Flickin' Chicken on the target within the least of throws as possible. The player with the lowest score after nine-rounds is the winner.

SETUP
1 - Each player chooses a Flickin' Chicken. Pay attention to the color, this is YOUR chicken!
2 - Designate someone to be the score keeper. This person will keep score during the game using the included Score-Keeper and pencil. Write each player's name in the Score-Keeper.
3 - The youngest player takes the Target Disc first. They will be the first to throw the disc and their Flickin' Chicken.

PLAYING EACH ROUND
1 - Flickin' Chicken is played in 9 rounds. The person with the lowest score after nine rounds is the winner.

2 - At the start of each round, throw the Target Disc as far as you can. For the first round, the youngest player throws first. For subsequent rounds, the winner of the previous round, play paper-scissor-rock, flip a coin or other tie-breaking ritual to determinate the thrower. Greco-Roman Wrestling is not reccomended.

3 - Taking turns, and starting with the Target Disc thrower, each player throws their Flickin' Chicken at the Target Disc, trying to land any part of their chicken on the disc. If you land any part of your Flickin' Chicken on the Target Disc on your first throw, this is a "Pollo-In-One". Everyone should congratulate you, as it's quite a feat.

4 - After everyone has thrown, it is now time for your next throw (if needed). The player whose chicken landed furthest from the target disc will go next (throwing from where the chicken landed) continuing with the next furthest player, so forth and so on.

5 - Repeat this until everyone has landed any part of their Flickin' Chicken onto the Target Disc. Once you hit the target disc, remove your chicken from play. Keep track of your throws as each throw is equal to one point.

6 - When every player has landed their chicken on the target the round is over. It is now time to score the round.

7 - Repeat the above until you have played all nine-rounds.

SCORING
1 - The target Disc has 2 sides, a Bonus side and a Penalty side. Each round is different depending on which side of the Target Disc is facing up after it lands!

2 - If any part of your Flickin' Chicken is TOUCHING the center white circle of the Target Disc then score accordingly and as follows:
"Penalty +1" - Add one point to your score if any part of your Flickin' Chicken is touching the Penalty Circle.
"Bonus -1" - Deduce one point from your score if any part of your Flickin' Chicken is touching the Bonus Circle.

3 - After determining if any Bonus or Penalty points apply to a players score, write their score in the Score-Keeper using the including pencil.

4 - After 9 rounds of play, tally up the players' scores. The player with the lowest score wins! (from the Rules-book)

item.description:
This is a game in Koplow's series of dice games that come in a tube and which usually feature dice where one side is replaced with a graphic of animal. In this case, you get five dice where the the one-pip is replaced with a graphic of an alligator.

The game is a simple dice rolling game - players roll the dice and need at least one alligator before they can score, They can set aside one alligator and other dice showing pipped sides which give the score - the other dice can be re-rolled once to attempt to improve the score. The player then decides whether to increase the size of their 'gator' by rolling all five dice and adding the sum of pipped dice to their score; however on this subsequent roll, any alligators rolled count as minus five points.

The player with the highest number of points after all the rolling wins.

This is operational level wargame based on Invasion Normandy. Small size and easy rule game.
It is mostly called "SS D-Day" because there are many games of the same name.

The Allied player aims at a success of the landing operations. The German player aims at the obstruction of the Allied Forces. Each game turn is divided into three impulse. The number of times that it can be activated by the unit is different.

This game was first published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with Battle of the Bulge.

All Time 9 is a baseball board game that includes 160 of some of the all time great players in baseball history. 
The statistical accuracy of the game lets players play out games using these all time greats from every era, up to the modern age of baseball.

The mechanic that sets it apart is the initial rolling of dice by the player controlling the pitcher, with a follow-up dice roll by the batter, in response to what the pitcher did. This accurately recreates the pitcher/batter duel, as opposed to other baseball boardgames that resolves all action in a single dice roll, with no input from one or the other of the 2 players involved.

Yonin Shogi or Four-handed Shogi is a four-player variant of shogi invented in 1993 but published in its current form in 1995.

The game is played using two subsets of standard shogi pieces and a standard 9x9 shogi board. Each of the four players gets one king, one rook, two gold generals, two silver generals, and three pawns.

The players sit around the board, one at each of the four sides. At start, each player's pieces are arranged in three rows forming a triangular pattern centered along the respective edge of board:

The objective of the game is to capture your opponents' kings. Individual play as well as team play is possible. Movement and capture are identical to standard shogi, except for check and checkmate.

Disassemblin' Dice is a dice game for 2-4 players using the Nestortiles game system. In Disassemblin' Dice, players build dice using Nestortiles, roll those dice to score points, and then disassemble and re-assemble the dice in order to create more powerful dice. Rolling a higher score than the other players allows a player to push their opponents' dice markers towards the end of the disassembly track. Once a player is knocked off the track, their die is disassembled, and they are out of the game. The last player to have their die disassembled wins.

Each tile that a player uses to assemble their dice changes the score that any roll yields. Players must carefully remove and add different tiles to their dice in order to maximize their chances of scoring higher than their opponents. Careful manipulation of the six Nestortiles and a bit of luck result in victory!

Early variation of the battleship type game.

ships noted are BB CA and DD's

Each ship generates a different number of shots and when the ship is sunk the player reduces the number of shots he takes.

Ship locations are noted on the pad and each turns shots are noted by turn. This creates a record of the game played.

The game appears to be a promotional item of the Krueger Brewing comapany. They closed their doors in 1961.

owner description:

This game is from Volume Sprayer Mfg Co of Tulsa Oklahoma and was produced in 1942.

The game comes with money in 1,000, 500,100,and 50 dollar denominations, 36 yellow and green combination cards and 36 red and black combination cards. The game also has 2 Dudecahedron dice (12 sided)

All of the number combination cards are placed face down and each player draws a card and places it face up. The first player decides if he is rolling red or yellow. The dice are then rolled and anyone who has a card showing on the table with the combination that has been rolled wins. If no one wins then they all keep the first card and turn over another one. The player must always declare the color that he is rolling. The accumulated cards that you have increases the payoff if you have a winning card. (you hold 6 cards, 4 red and 2 yellow. The roller declares Red and rolls a 3 and a 9. One of your red cards has that 3 and 9 grouping so you win the value of the roll times 4 for the number of red cards that you have.

A time limit is suggested as to when the game ends.

In Monster auf der Flucht, five monsters are escaping from their exploding home planet to find a new home, and each player will secretly be assigned one of these monsters to watch over and care for. At the end of the round, the monster farthest away from its home planet scores 0 points – it went a tad too far, mind you – while the second farthest monster scores 3 points, and the other monsters in order score 2, 1 and -1 points.

item.description: Six Shooter is a fun, fast-paced, easy to learn dice game where all players play at the same time. Each player rolls 6 dice and attempts to complete the goal on the current card. The first player to get 6 in a row on their board wins!

A Fistful of Tripods is a set of miniatures war game rules that cover the Marian invasion described by H. G. Wells in his novel "War of the Worlds".

Players can re-create the first "historical" Martian invasion of 1890's (which was an all out rout of the humans), or play one of several alternate scenarios from the 1920's through the 1990's.

The rules are based on the Fistful of TOWS miniatures rule set.

This description is paraphrased from the introductory section of the rulebook.

We invite you into middle ages where in scriptorium (latin for "a place for writing") Benedictine monks would copy and illustrate books and manuscripts. Your task in the game is to help the scribe to collect sentences that were scattered through out the monastery. The player, who will collect the most complete sentences and will deliver them to scriptorium will be a winner. Game combines spin and move with classic memory mechanic adding some special twists into the mix.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland.

name.value: Capt'n Sharky: Ab auf die Palme
Capt'n Sharky: Climb the coconut tree!
Capt'n Sharky: Grimpe sur le palmier!
Capt'n Sharky: Klim in de palmboom!

item.description:
Capt'n Sharky and his friends have discovered a new island. Right in the center of it, Sharky sees a large palm with many of coconuts. The friends decide to pick them off, but watch out - upwards is not the only way!

An exciting contest is about to start - who will reach the top first and pick the biggest coconut.

Players draw cards, showing which two characters they support. These Cards are kept hidden. 
Each Player has a set of cards, allowing him to move various characters up and down the tree. The goal is to collect the most valuable coconuts with the own characters without being identified by the others, what would enable them to play negative cards on the right target. The player who's characters have collected the most valuable coconuts at the end of the game wins.

An asymmetric strategy game based on Britain’s answer to the West Virginia Mothman sightings. The game can be played using pieces from a chess and checkers set. Owlman is an abstract strategy game with unequal forces, based on a loose theme of cryptozoological investigation.

The Owlman side has just one piece (a black knight) which starts in the upper left corner. Doc's side has Doc (a white king starting in the lower right corner) and 12 helpers (checkers starting near Doc).

Owlman's main objective is to frighten all of Doc's helpers out of the woods. Doc aims to reach the Owlman's lair (the upper left corner), along with one of his helpers (adjacent to the corner), who will help him set up his "cryptozoological" camera.

The game is played in alternating turns, moving pieces on the 8x8 board. All pieces can step to an adjacent space. Only Owlman can capture, by stepping toward a helper, who is then frightened out of the woods. Owlman also has a special "swoop" move (like an elongated knight's move, but 4x2 instead of 3x2).

The game is published in the December 2010 issue of GAMES Magazine and online at http://owlmanthegame.blogspot.com/

Online play: Super Duper Games

item.description:
"Ora et Labora" is Latin for for pray and work is a principle of the Benedictine monasteries. In this game players are young helpers arriving to the monastery to learn about the life of Benedictine monks. This can be done by completing tasks (that ask players to collect sets of cards like writing materials, sentences etc.). Board presents a clock with main activities of the monastery (like prayers, work in the scriptorium or in the garden) and players can can choose in which of the shortly starting activities they want to participate (represented by them moving pawn on board). Next the player can use the ability of the field he moved to (drawing card, exchanging card with a common poll, completing tasks etc.). Each completed task gives a player certain amount of points and allows him or her to draw another task card. Game follows this pattern until one of the players collect enough points.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland

item.description:
From the designer.

The year is 2382 and the Milky Way Galaxy is teeming with life. The petty intra-planetary squabbles of the last millennium have given way to the hustle and bustle of interstellar commerce and entrepreneurship. Can you compete in the 24th Century? Play Galactic Frontier and see if you have what it takes!

Players select unique races (variable player powers) and set out to be the most successful entrepreneurs in the Milky Way. Players use influence markers to stake claim to resources and to keep their opponents at bay. By carefully managing their research efforts in 8 unique fields, players gain access to more advanced technology. The player who earns the most victory points by delivering rare minerals, advancing up the technology ladders, and avoiding the pesky space pirates will be the winner.

A pure dice rolling two player game. To win the game, a player must be the first one to have all numbers from 1 to 10 either marked or locked. Two dice is used to hit the numbers. A turn, ie. rolling the dice, continues as long as results of both dice (individual results or their sum) can be used in actions.

The actions are:-
 1 mark own unmarked number, or
 2 unlock(mark) own locked number, or
 3 unmark the other player's marked number

At the beginning of a turn, a player is supposed lock all his remaining marked numbers (that the other player has not managed to unmark on his turn). During a turn, a player has an option to unlock some of these numbers (depending on the dice results), but can decide to not do so.

name.value: Quiz!: Tack för att du visar leg.

item.description:
A simple quiz game with cards. All in all the game comes with 160 questions in various topics.

No rules are included, other than that you play to 15 points.

Le Super Morpion Tournant (The Great Turning Tic Tac Toe) is a "tri-dimensional turning tactical game" according to the label on the side of the game box. The game is 3D four-in-a-row game with some distinct differences from the common forms such as Score Four:

The game is for two or four players.
 The game box contains a brief rule sheet in French, a game board, and 64 beads in four colors, 16 of each color.
 The middle of the game board consists of a four by four array of 16 rods, the central four of which are placed on a turntable. Thus, the central four rods may be turned relative to the board. In the periphery of the game board is space for an additional 16 rods which may be arranged in the corners (four player game) or along the ends (two player game). Each rod is able to contain a stack of four beads.

At the beginning of the game each player starts out with 32 beads, eight of each color (two player game) or 16 beads, for of each color (four player game). All of beads are positioned at the peripheral rods at start.

On turn, each player is either placing one of his/her beads on one of the 16 central rods on the game board, or turning the central plate 90 degrees clockwise.

The objective of the game is to create alignments of four different colored beads. Each such alignment earns the player one point. The player with most points at the end of the game (when all the beads have been played) is the winner.

SUWS/NSUWS is a simple introductory system which allows to simulate land and naval battles mainly during the pre-gunpowder era.

It is easy to understand and play and players must face the same problems of their historic counterparts, finding some battles very hard to win, and to lose, or very slow or fast, finding themselves in the same climax of the leaders which fought hundreds of years ago.

The game includes:

Two set of rules, basic, for easy introduction, and advanced, for a deeper game.

Two scenarios books including naval and land battles ranging from ancient Greek and Roman era to European medieval and to Japan civil war; covering battles never simulated before like Al-Qadisiyyah or Dan-No-Ura.

Each battle has its own map (of a standard size) and includes advanced and special rules if needed.

More than 1,000 front-back easy-to-understand counters including Leaders, infantry, cavalry, archers, ships and other units with unique symbols based on era and geographic area, European and eastern, of all forces involved.

Charts and table.

The game is open to suggestions, new ideas and scenarios, and a blank map and blank counter sheet is included to help in development.

Actually the game is in Italian tongue only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE is a science fiction game of exploration, colonization, war and conquest in deep space; it is a cross-over of the first edition of Twilight Imperium and of Conquest of Paradise from GMT taking elements from both.

It is a fast and easy game to play and learn, it is good to introduce new players to wargames or for a one-session evening.

The game includes:

 Easy to understand Rules
 240 Megahexes used to build the map
 Nearly 800 front-back counters including troops, colonies, planetary defences, warships, explorer and more
 27 Random events cards
 Charts and tables for easy play
 The game system is based on Kevin McPartland Conquest of Paradise (GMT) fantastic game.




Currently the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! is an economic-oriented game inspired to Role-Playing Games, what future awaits an old sorcerer, fighter, paladin etc. after their retirement?

How they invest their gold pieces and how they maintain their glory and fame?

In E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! 3-6 players are ex-adventures whose, once retired, are trying to invest their gold, trying go to become more and more famous and to climb social hierarchy and now, becoming older, they need the services of young adventures.

To reach their targets now they must buy land, build manors, trying to attract people and build a little village, engage young adventurers to defend their proprieties, and defend themselves from any kind of bureaucracy, an hard work, the main challenge must still start…

The game includes:

 Easy to understand Rules
 Map of a city and surrounding area
 Counters including gold, adventures, manors and more.
 Charts and tables for easy play.
 The game system is based on “Metropolis” (Editoy) game.




Actually the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Designer Gian Carlo Porciani
Artist Gian Carlo Porciani

Dragon Flight is a racing game for 2-4 players.

Using strategy and luck, players must race their dragons across a modular map, avoiding obstacles and attacks from their competitors.

On each turn players use hand cards to enable their dragon to fly at defined speeds and altitude across a modular hex map, containing obstacles of various heights, namely floating mountains.

Race your dragons through the rings, placed at various height weigh points and back home again, making best use of your cards and the available thermals (up-drafts and down-drafts) to gain and lose height. Attack your enemies with powerful flame attacks and force them to lose control.

Paranoia is a game of tiles fast-paced and furious. And that happens because there are no turns. As in a discussion without a moderator, where no one respects the word and all speak at once, in Paranoia all play at once. But, in the middle of this whirlpool, there are rules that everyone must respect and give the game a fair balance between the noise and reflection, between order and chaos ...

Initially, all players receive 10 hexagonal tiles and they must put them in their stand.

The objective is to be the first to play all your pieces.

Players are sailors who try to reach America before the other players, starting from Europe and crossing Atlantic ocean. During the perilious travel they'll have to avoid storms, mutinies, hull crashes, winds, also thanks to Colombo's cards' help.

In order to achieve their objective they'll have to draw and play the right cards and to move their ships the fastest way possible to reach the american coasts.

From the Perfect Captain website:

The first in our series of Spare Change games, Villehardouin is a campaign game of the Byzantine Reconquest of the Morea in southern Greece in the year 1263 AD.

Players take the role of either the Achaean Franks under Prince William de Villehardouin, freshly back from captivity in Constantinople, or that of the Byzantine Empire under the Sebastocrator Constantine (the Emperor Michael VIII's step-brother).

As with all of our games, supply and logistics are as important as naked force. Never fear- there is of course no bookkeeping. At the start of each turn players figure out how much "change" they gather to fuel their activities for the turn. Simply marching off into arid and barren territory, even if it is strategically important, will leave you high and dry and out of supply- forcing a humiliating retreat. Players must plan carefully where they are going, how long they will be there, and what can go wrong; losing a battle will deplete your treasury as well as your army.

The opposing armies are different too, adding another element to strategy. The Franks have excellent cavalry and good foot troops, but not many skirmishers. The Greeks have an abundance of archers and ambushers as well as hard fighting regulars, and a corps of Turkish mercenaries (of dubious loyalty..). Both sides have to pick their battlefields and their timing must be near-perfect to pull off a game-winning battle.

The terrain is not the friendliest; each players base is green and lush, but you can't win by sitting still. Feint and counter-feint will be the order of the day, but when the time comes, you must strike. Sieges can be long, but sudden assaults costly. Greeks can set up ambushes while the Franks can attempt impetuous charges- either one can, if handled properly, bring about your opponent's overthrow.

This is the kind of game where there can be no wasted moves; everything is important, and dilly-dallying will hurt you sooner rather than later. This is a game that will lead to taut nerves and a lot of beard stroking!

Does it take long to play?
That's entirely up to you. You could easily fly through it in an hour, but if you want to win you'll need to think things through very carefully. Still, it's one of our quickest-play games.

Two players game: one player will take control of Danguard, hero of the humanity who will have to stop the other player evil project to harm terrestrial bases with his terrible ufo robots. Danguard will win by destroying 3 ufo robots. Ufo robots will win by occupying and destroying 4 terrestrial bases

Adventure game where players will travel worldwide, from Africa to America, from Asia to Australia. The game is divided in two main phases: during the first phase players will decide where to go, the right season, try to search a good sponsor supporting their expedition and buy the right items to survive.
During the second phase they'll leave for the expedition and try to do their best to avoid accidents and hazards also thanks to their equipment.
The winning player is the one completing the adventure first.

Team-based card-game with a fantasy theme.

Players group in teams and struggle for the dominion over the land of Mystras. Each team starts with a treasury of 50.000 Iros (the local currency) and tries to exaust the other team's treasure by winning battles. Players have also to spend the Iros in order to gain cards from the personal marketplaces of each player, thus needing to balance the expenses in order to avoid damaging their own team.

The game box includes:
- 36 pages rulebook
- 196 cards
- 8 Marketplace player mats

Available in Italian since October 2010. International editions to follow.

item.description:
How many words, movie titles or famous people, can you and your team guess in 90 seconds? Set the word generator on your head, press it and a word appears. More than 2000 names, movies, objects and animals can be shown on the word generator. You're teammates can sing or yell instructions. You should lose no time to guess who or what's on your head because you have 90 seconds to guess as much words or names as possible. Ben Ik Napoleon is a party game where the fun and enthusiasm splashes.

(From the Publishers website)

Bible Caravan is a travel game that takes players on an imaginary trip through the Holy Land for the purpose of learning the location and significance of 30 places described in the Bible.

Each player gets a map board of the Holy Land depicting a caravan route. Players then select text filled tiles that match their caravan route cities, and play the tiles upon their board, matching the city tiles with Bible verses printed on the right side of the map board. Scoring is determined by locations filled and correct verse identifications.

Social(c) is the game of social interaction! While working together, construct a question that someone must answer. Each player gets a hand full of cards with a single word on them. As the turns go around the table, each player plays a single word. Once the question is complete, someone must answer the question. Will it be you? The question being asked is both uniquely your choice and the choices of others. Be careful though, you might be the one that must answer! Earn points based upon the words chosen in your sentence. After the question is answered, the real fun begins. Participate in mini-games that include everything from storytelling, acting, dance offs, trivia challenges, a game of craps, or a stare off. Each expansion comes with its own twists and challenges!

Social comes in several different flavors, each to meet the needs and interests of the gamer. Unlike most modular expandable games, Social does not require all previous expansions to be able to play the game. A single base kit is required along with any number of expansions to create a personalized deck of cards. Some base kits come with expansions. The purpose is to provide new gamers with popular expansions for cheaper pricing and an enhanced level of customizations to decks.

Additional expansions are able to be purchased separately.

The white label expansion includes the very basic set of Social.

Included within this tasty morsel are 189 playing cards that are sure to keep even the most loquacious gamers busy. 2-4 players. Ribbon, box, and cards included. A great starter set for any Socialite!

Source of information (Company website, Social Flyer, and Instructions).

item.description:
“Abetto” is a dynamic, exciting game, where players become gentlemen and ladies brought from Arsen Lupin's stories and compete with each other for the name of the greatest burglar, lover and fencer of the nobel underworld.
 There are several ways to achieve success. By means of committing burglary you can get trophies and gadgets that are essential to win the game. They also help you in overcoming challenges of the game as well as give you an opportunity to harm your opponents. By shooting at rivals or dueling with them you can steal their chosen trophies but you may also lose yours.
 Mechanics of the game is based on modified roulette rules. Players bet the result on a special even/odd table and a number table (1-36). The probability of failure is small – only 25% - and can be further reduced by means of some gadgets. The esthetic wooden roulette is attached to the game.
 In order to smooth down certain randomness that accompanies burglaries, shoots and duels, so called task cards were introduced to the game. There is a different task for each round and after accomplishing it a player receives prize in the form of trophies and gadgets. Fulfilling the task depends solely on player’s behavior.
 The game board is based on a tile system. Players arrange it themselves and each time they compose a different district in which the game takes place.
 Abetto game provides large interaction between players and a great deal of emotions. Even during another player’s turn you take active part in the game.

Publisher Blurb

item.description:
This game takes us across the map through the large cities of Europe and the adjacent Mediterranean countries. The aim is to be the first player to put down all of his Citycards. You can do this by working the shortest route between cities. The more often you play the game the better you will know your way about the map, the better you willbe able to select your routes critically, and the faster you will be able to put down you cards.

The game is a variant from Explore Europe but without dices.

name.value: Deadliest Catch Sea Adventure Board Game

item.description: Now you can be the captain of your all-time favorite Deadliest Catch ship: Time Bandit, Wizard, Northwestern, or Cornelia Marie and compete for the most "red gold" aka Alaskan King Crag. Survive the hazards of the Bering Sea as you race to drop your crab pots and return to port with the largest crab count. The board game that recreates all the winning show action! Game includes quad-fold game board, 18 navigation cards, 20 crab pots, 6 hazard chips, Coast Guard chip, and 4 ship markers

name.value: 100 Really Dumb Things You Have to do While Playing This Game

item.description: In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

A cooperative game in which 1-4 players race against time to jointly solve crimes. The game board is a map of the city of Osh Vegas. Crimes occur randomly throughout the city. The police move to the crime scenes as allowed by a special movement die. Then using five 6-sided dice, crimes are solved if the police on the scene can roll 3 of the same number. To win, the players must solve all of the crimes before time runs out.

From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help. Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table. Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

From the box:
Hours OF FUN for 1 or 2 players. Play at home or carry along to play while traveling.

YOU CALL THE PLAYS! Run...Kick...Pass. There are touchdowns, pass interceptions, fumbles, penalties, field goals, in fact, everything but a water boy.
All the thrills of a real football game are enjoyed while playing this game. Never two games alike.

Play using regulations football rules of your choice: high school,college or professional rules. Se enclosed cards with rules on how to play and instructions on easy way to keep track of te first downs, line of scrimmage, etc.

From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles. Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places. Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places". Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

Statistical replay game on basketball, featuring many different expansion sets. Basic game is very simple: each team is rated for points made, points allowed, rebounds and assists, plus it has a special value based on historical performance in the tournament (used to give a possible random variation to a few of his ratings). Opposing teams compare their value and a die is rolled for each team to determine the score. It is a fast replaying simulation, with a good bit of accuracy in the final result.

For the moment the following sets are available (directly from the designer, Roberto Chiavini or from Wargamer Vault): WNBA (all seasons) NBDL (all seasons), original ABA (all seasons), all the NBA from 1951 in single decades

Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

This is a strategic dice placement game for 2 - 4 players. Each player takes the roll of a strain of bacteria in a petri dish, and begins to mutate and grow their strain in an effort to be the biggest.

Every turn you roll two D6 spotted dice, and then place one of these on the board according to a set of simple rules. Do you extend your strain or do you focus on breaking apart an opponents? Do you risk expansion into a contested portion of the playing area or do you focus on strengthening, but not lengthening, your strain? Every turn has interesting and strategic decisions to be made all from a simple roll of two dice.

You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-dead-minigame.html

name.value: Ramar of the Jungle, The New Jungle Game

item.description:
This game is a spin and move game where the object is to capture valuable animals in the jungle. The game board is filled with face down animals and by spinning a spinner and then moving your playing piece onto one of those animals you capture it. The game continues until all of the animals have been captured. Turning over each animal reveals a value attached to that particular animal. The player who captures the most valuable animals wins the game. When a player lands on an animal, his playing piece remains on that spot until his/her next turn and other players cannot land on or move over that spot, They must use their roll number to move around the opponents piece. The designers name appears to be Dexter Wayne but research is still being done on that fact.

Game for ages 7-10

From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

User summary:

Theme - A fortune telling game based on cards and pendulum. Played solo or between two players with roles of questioner (later on just Q) and interpreter (N). The interpreter leads the game and the questioner is the one receiving information about his/her home, work, personality, love, future and past.

Game-play - The game-play is divided into two phases 1) the card turning and 2) the pendulum swinging.

1) The card turning phase starts by picking up the proper coloured scarabs to the game board; the hair, eyes and favourite colour of the Q. The Q shuffles the purple 54 card deck and hands it over to N. N divides the deck into 3 separate decks of 18, 9 and 27 cards. The cards are dealt on the game board in the order 18, 27 and 9. The 18 cards are dealt on locations shown at the front page of the rule leaflet. The cards have 6 words in them and one of those is picked depending which is forming a pyramid with the game board (the black half of the pyramid on the left side of the card and the white half of the pyramid on the game board). While the cards are dealt, the N questions the Q if the word on the cards have any special meaning. The forming words are related to either home (1st vertical row), work (2nd), personality (3rd), love (4th), future (5th) or past (6th), depending which vertical row the cards are placed to. The 27 cards are then dealt on the game board (some restrictions apply, see the rule leaflet). Then the deck of 9 cards is used as a key to whole interpretation. At last the rest cards of the deck of 27 are used to check if something is being dominant on some areas of the Q's life. The final interpretations varies each playing time.

2) The pendulum swinging phase starts by placing the four decks of 28 cards onto the game board. The decks are placed on lower part of the game board, around the pyramid (letter A shown on the first page of the rule leaflet). The decks represents the areas of home, work, personality and love. The players decide one of the four categories and Q decides a question he/she wants to get answered related to that category. The transparent pyramid is placed on the game board and the pendulum is used for random number selection. There is numbers of 1-28 around the pyramid on the game board and the random pendulum swing decides the number of the chosen card. The N reads the text on the proper card to the Q. Same is repeated to other categories and questions.

Goal of the game - Interpreting the message gotten with cards and pendulum and gaining more self-consciousness.

The game includes:

1 game board
1 transparent pyramid
1 pendulum
4 decks of cards (28 cards each)
1 purple deck of cards (54 cards)
2 bags including different coloured scarab buttons
1 rule leaflet (4 pages)

From Finnish intro on the rule leaflet:

"Karnak on kiehtovan jännittävä ennustuspeli, jota voi pelata yksin tai yhdessä. Se perustuu eräisiin muinaisegyptiläisiin mysteereihin ja kulttuuriperinteisiin. Koska peli on tunnettujen astrologian ja horoskooppien asiantuntijoiden suunnittelema, pelaajat voivat sen avulla myös kehittää omaa kuudetta aistiaan ja salattuja kykyjään. Luonnollisesti sitä voidaan pelata myös pelkkänä pelinä, mutta moni varmasti mielellään käyttää sitä oman itseymmärryksensä kehittämiseen ja hankkii sen avulla tietoja sisimmästä minuudestaan. Näitä tietoja voi sitten soveltaa toisten, kenties vähemmän onnekkaiden ihmisten auttamiseen."

item.description:
Königsberg ´45( # 104-1 ), is a boardgame covering the Soviet attack on East Prussia in 1945.

The game handles the 20 first days of the attack starting on the 13th of January 1945. The 3rd Belorussian Front under command of Cherniakhovsky launches an attack into the northeast of East Prussia while the 2nd Belorussian Front, commanded by Rokossovsky, one day later starts an attack from the south east. However, Army Group Mitte, under the command of Reinhardt, puts up an astonishing defence desperatly pushing the Soviets back.
The time is however on the Soviet side and when the defence finally crumbles there is nothing left to withstand the Soviet troops to ravage the country.

Königsberg ´45 is taught in 30 minutes and easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players. It is built around the same system of rules that have shaped both Plan West and the upcoming Tanneberg 1914.
The game uses a chit pull system telling you which armies to move. Each turn is two days and the game has 10 turns.

Components:

 50 x 70cm-size map
 280 die-cut counters
 1 six-sided die
 Rules
 Box

link.value: Konigsberg: The Soviet Attack on East Prussia, 1945

item.description:
Banana village is having their annual village run. This year you entered to win the Banana Cup, but you are not the only one who hungers for the cup.

Village Run is for 2 or more player game where players roll for speed and hoping to take the first place. During the game players will get power up box to take advantage over their opponents. The game use a unique speed system, in where players will have a decision whether to stay on the same speed or try to roll their luck to speed up or getting slow. Village Run also features combat in which players will try to land on a box tile to get an advantage over the other players. The game can be played around 15 minutes and whole lots of exciting laps of Village Run.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.

item.description:
From the back of the box (translated from croatian):

"Tibor becomes a vampire. To return among normal people, Tibor has a long way from his village to the castle of Countess Zarina Sibilskog in which Kosinius, a scientist created a magic potion for the vampire. Will Kosinius' magic potion help Tibor to become again an ordinary person?"

Content:
1 board
40 playing tiles
10 scoring tiles

In this simple game the players place tiles on a grid, trying to connect their village with their castle (if they place a tile with a garlic on it, they gain a score tile with 1-3 points). The player who first reaches the castle gains ten points.

item.description:
Zip! is a tactical boardgame for 2 to 4 players, in which each player is searching for a buried treasure and, once found, tries to get away with the loot.
Who finds a treasure, has a bigger chance to win, but has to be extra careful too, because each player can "zip" his/her stone around the board to hit an opponent's stone in a flash, removing the opponent from play and stealing his/her treasure on top of that.
All stones are being moved simultaneously (players can hit the stone of an opponent in another players' turn) and for expert players there's a variation in which all player's stones are invisible!

The lush green grass of irish meadows and a homey shelter provide a pleasurable life for black sheep as well as white ones. A feast for the old lazy wolf. That's why you should keep an eye on your herd with help of the shepherd and his dog.

A strategic two player game about tending sheep. Each player moves sheep around the meadows and either into the shelter for twosomeness or off the board to score. A core mechanic is to keep an eye on blancing the size and composition of the flocks. The wolf will kill one of the sheep in the largest flock and you should make sure its not one of yours! You win by scoring enough points or reduce the opponents sheep so they can no longer mate.

As all the "Mini-Lederspiele" of Hiku-Spiele this game comes with several semi-precious stones in a leather pouch that when opened is the board of the game.

Total Soccer is the classic table footballs which recreate a Football game play with fingers.

It has evolved from the Subbuteo game, improving material quality and the playability, besides to have the licenses of the best football clubs around the world.

The way of playing is nearly identical to Subbuteo, player flick minature soccer players around the field to move, pass the ball, and attempt to score on the goal.

For two players, you can use only the fingers to win the match. Normally the duration is around 30 minutes (15 minutes for half).


Total Soccer es el clásico juego de fútbol de mesa que recrea un partido de fútbol con los dedos.

Es un producto que evoluciona del Subbuteo, mejorando la calidad de los materiales y su jugabilidad, además de ser licenciado por los mejores equipos del mundo.

El modo de jugar es idéntico a Subbuteo... pero con mejores componentes!!

Para dos jugadores, solo puedes usar los dedos para ganar el partido. Normalmente la duración son 30min aproximadamente (15 minutos por tiempo)

item.description:
The Game consists of 3 games: The Steamboatgame (Het Stoombootspel), The Giftgame (Het Pakjesspel) and The Memoryvariant.

All games are based on a dutch special-day: Sinterklaas. This is the dutch version of SantaClaus and is celebrated on december 5th each year.

In The Steambootgame players use there playingfigure to collect presents from the hold of the ship on the gameboard. They do no know the value of the present they took.Via stairs and rooms of 3 different colors they attempt to bring them to the deck, to secure them. To do so, they throw a dice with the 3 different colors on it. A player must stop in a room of that color. When 2 players are in the same room, they have to switch presents. Two special actions which are in some rooms give players the chance to look at another players present, or his own, or to catch up with another player who is at max two stories higher in the ship. If all presents are on the deck, the player with the highest value of presents wins the game!

In The Giftgame players buy a few small presents upfront. They agree on the amount of money to be spent. You can also use the chips in the game and play for points.In this game also the colordice is used to decide to what field on the gameboard the player moves his playingfigure to. On each field is a different symbol, each giving a different action. The possible actions are: Take a present, switch presents and open them up, give present away to the player with the fewest presents, all presents in front of the players are passed to your neighbour in a clockwise fasion. and finally open up a present. When there are no more presents in the pile, the game ends. When playing with chips in stead of real presents, the game ends as soon as the last chip is taken from the supply. The player with the most points wins!~

The Memoryvariant is just another memory: There are 2 pairs of 12 different colored-and-valued chips. Turn them up-side-down so the sack is showing, shuffle them, and try to find the matching pairs as in regular memory. The player witrh the most chips wins.

item.description: Wend-maze is a path building game in the Wend family for two to four players. The players use Wend tiles to construct a maze which they are trying to escape from. They have a series of actions they can take to place tiles, move or rotate them, switch the lights on or off, or move along the maze. They roll dice to determine the action they will take. The object of the game is to be the first player to escape from the maze.

A word game based on the popular Catalan TV show "Bocamoll", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya since 2007. Following the show structure, it is composed by six different tests on words: matching words with their definitions, guessing words from images and symbols, filling-in popular song lyrics with the correct words, deciphering SMS language texts, etc.

The game includes:
- board
- 500 cards
- 4 markers
- bag
- hourglass
- rules booklet

A roll-and-move game based on the Catalan TV show "Caçadors de bolets", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya. The players try to win in this particular race of mushroom hunting, correctly identifying mushroom types.

The game includes:
- board
- 6 markers
- 112 mushroom cards
- 300 cards
- rulebook

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: It is a 12-page booklet describing the rules for a naval battle, intended to use with Navwar's miniatures. Each ship has maximum movement, fighting value and armament. Players simultaneously decide about movement, then each ship can fire. There are also rules covering ramming, close combat and morale.

name.value: IQ: A szerencse és logika játéka!

item.description: The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

The game contains 60 cards, these are divided in 3 times 20 each numbered from 1 to 20. The three categories are: body, face and legs.

The cards are then divided between all the players. Each player gets the same amount of faces, bodies and legs. Now the players have to make the most animals with the same number on all the three body parts.

The rest of the cards they can exchange with other players. There are different ways to do this in the rulebook. The player with the highest number of animals reconstituted won.

(User Summary)

The cards all show a couple of different animal types. There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card. The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.

In Le jeu des fruits you have to get rid of all of your cards. There are six sorts of fruit on the cards: pears, bananas, plums, strawberries, oranges or pineapples. Each fruit is now 0-5 times on the cards.

A player must always play a card that has more fruit on it then the previous card that has been played in one of the fruit categories. For example, if the visible card shows two pears, three plums and a banana, you can play any card that contains three or more pears, two or more bananas, four or more plums.

Medieval Mastery is a board game of tactical conquest based on the feudal system that existed in Europe throughout the Middle Ages. Set in France, during a time of turmoil, each player assumes the role of a provincial lord as the country erupts into a war of succession. Send your brave knights forth to conquer the surrounding lands in an all-out struggle to claim the throne!

Medieval Mastery incorporates area control, hand management and modular board design as well as variable player powers and phase order. The rules include alternate gameplay variations. This, coupled with a modular game board and a random combination of crowns, orbs and sceptres, means that no two games will ever be the same! In addition, the number of components included allows for up to three games of varying sizes to be played simultaneously!

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Tricky Double works a bit on the principle of Raj but makes it an 'adult' version. Players simultaneous choose a card and reveal it and then have to select a second card and reveal this one too. You win with the combination of these two cards.

The lower cards in the deck hold coins, the person who gets the most of these coins wins the game. The lower the card, the more points it has. So if you want to score a lot of points you will also have to play out a low card from your hand but still want to get the highest result in the end.

(User summary)

The game has two phases: first you have to put all the stars on the board and after this you can turn of the light and they will glow in the dark. Now that we are in the dark the second phase starts.

Each at a turn takes away one star from the board. The player who's star stays on the board as last wins the game. It sounds easy but since you are in the dark, a good memory will help.

The game contains:
- A large die
- Twelve twinkling starts
- A board 
- A sandman

(User summary)

Heilig of Geilig? is a dutch partygame. It can be translated as Holy or Horny?

The players take trivia cards on which a 3 different hints are stated. These are vague and ambiguous and describe an object. The players have to guess the answer to get points. When they get it wrong they show their own 'horny' nature.

All players start at the same starting point on the board, this is in the middle of the board. On the one side are the holy/heilige points, on the other side the horny/geilige pionts. The oldest player begins. He takes a card and chooses one of the three hints from the card and reads it to his neighbour his leftside. When the player guesses the object with this one hint he may move up to 4 places. If a second hint is needed he moves up 3 places. After a third hint he can move up 2 places. But if passes after the 3 hint he has to move back 1 place. When he guessed wrong he has to move back 2 spaces. The game ends when a player gets at the top of the holy points.

The game contains:
- A board
- Pawns
- 300 playing cards

Crime & Mystery - that says it all. The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence"-cards. Afterwards, all the cards are shuffled and 7 cards are drawn. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

In this game you have to listen closely, remember and combine the facts in the right way. After 2 cases (approximately 20 min.) the game ends and the points are summed up.

––––––––––––––––

In Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files, dem neuen, ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiel für bis zu sechs Spieler muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um an Hand der Indizien und Hinweise den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen.

Die Spieler übernehmen die Rollen von Detektiven, die eng mit Scotland Yard, der englischen Kriminalpolizei, zusammenarbeiten. Am Anfang des Spieles wird einer von vier Fällen herausgesucht. Die Spieler entscheiden sich im Anschluss daran, welchen der acht Verdächtigen sie observieren wollen, so dass sie einen präzisen Bericht über ihren Verdächtigen vortragen können. Dieser Bericht beruht auf den gezogenen Indizienkarten, die vor dem Beginn der Observation gezogen werden. Die Indizienkarten sind jeweils auf die verschiedenen Fälle zugeschnitten.

Nachdem alle Ermittler ihren Bericht innerhalb einer definierten Zeitspanne vorgetragen haben, müssen die Spieler verschiedene Fragen und Aussagen bezüglich der vorgetragenen Indizien mit den Verdächtigen in Einklang bringen.

Der Spieler, dem dies gelingt und einen Verdächtigen erfolgreich als Täter überführt, gewinnt die Partie. Ein Spiel besteht dabei aus zwei Partien, sprich zwei Fällen.

item.description:
A bi-collaborative game where two teams of gamers group together to try to accomplish game objectives and stay alive for the duration of this game set in downtown Milwaukee, WI USA. The game will involve dice-based combat, but will have multiple paths to victory for both the monsters and the humans, both fighting for different things.

One group will consist of six monsters: a cow; a crayfish; an asian carp; a gorilla; a bluegill; and two deep-tunnel sewer rats. The other group will consist of humans, plus humans with functions like workmen, fire fighters, police, nat'l guard, and some super-humans like Lara Croft and ninjas might appear during gameplay.

The game is driven foremost by the HO scale minis used in the game, and the plastic monsters. The toy value is what this Über-Ameritrash game is about.There will be multiple rule sets developed. Really, this game started with the toys, and a desire to improve an old game or two, while thematically morphing it into a game which featured downtown Milwaukee, WI USA.

At this point it's a prototype. The game is a homage to The Creature That Ate Sheboygan, borrows from Heorscape and Monsters Menace America, requires some D&D features like THACO, and has lots of other options for tweaks and alt games.

The "ha ha" is deliberate in the name because of the twisted humor woven into the fabric of the game. The "bronze fonz" is on the map, and either side will get a bonus for either destroying it or simply rubbing it for good luck. Names for the creatures also have built-in humor:

Vince Gill: the bluegill who is also a Packer fan, but hates Milwaukeeans because of their fascination with the Friday Fish Fry. His desire is to crush restaurants which serve fish.

Son of Samson: the undead giant son of the most famous ex-resident of the Milwaukee Zoo, whose goal is to get to the top of the Firstar/U.S. Bank tower and fling poo.

Carpie Diem: an asian carp, who seized headlines recently as the no.1 environmental enemy to Lake Michigan. He can jump across city blocks and smash things under his weight. Very easily distracted by the Ladybug Club, thinking they are asian lady beetles.

Holey Cow: a sympathizer with O'Leary's Chicago firestarter, this copycow is a Cubs fan and happens to breathe methane gas fires from her four stomachs, and out her nostrils. She's also capable of making massive cowpies which block city streets.

'Hood Ratz: a pair of residents from our failed Deep Tunnel system, these rodents are skaven mad *wink* and capable of chewing through even the five foot thick walls of the Fed Bldg. They're also attracted to hip-hop music.

Rebecca the Boiling Crayfish: (no relation to our new Lt. Governor of WI) she's looking for her crawdaddy in one of the restaurants that serve her brethren. The humans are in hot water this time.

The game narrative is such that an event has taken place that, combined with the deep tunnel sewer failure, has caused six local creatures to grow in size and terrorize Brewtown.

The Federal Bldg. is within the now quarantined section of Brewtown, and the goals of the monsters are many, but they have to achieve them before they are killed or the feds are able to call in the antidote. Meanwhile, the humans are to stay alive and kill monsters,while protecting buildings from fires, repairing blocked roads, and achieving other goals along the way.

There are several groups of humans:

Firefighters: complete with a new ladder truck, these six individuals have axes and hoses in hand *wink* to face any challenge.

Police: one car (Milwaukee police are grossly underfunded) and a handful of officers help with attacks, rescue civilians, and keep the peace among the surviving humans.

National Guard: these weekend warriors with five tanks were setting up for maneuvers downtown, ending in at the Veterans Memorial nearby when this hit. They've not got much live ammo with them for this reason, but they have plenty of rubber bullets of all sizes-and they look scary as hell. The can fly in one helicopter from General Mitchell Airport in a couple of rounds, and it will have the firepower they need, but the rest of the military is on furlough.

Municipal Construction: several men on a job site with a huge dump truck, a CAT backhoe, and two CAT scoopshovels. They're tough enough to fight the monsters on their own with their equipment and they're experts at "catcalls".

Waste Management: one unmanned truck full of Milwaukee's finest refuse, abandoned.

Superhumans: activated at different times in the game when humans accomplish certain goals: a Lara Croft lookalike, with the guns to prove it; a ninja; two advanced swordplay students from the T'ai Chi Ch'uan center of Milwakee, and their leader Mike. Mike's wearing a Yoda costume he found at the Milwaukee Film office, and his mastery of push hands gives him the equivalent of the "force push". He hopes the creatures watched the trilogy, and fear him...

The two collaborative groups struggle until the game ends for a variety of reasons. There are several paths of victory for either team.

A 2 player board game.

The purpose of the game is to find as many combinations as it’s possible which sum is exactly 10. Every combination has to consist of exactly three digits situated on three neighbouring areas connected with edges or with corners. Each area can only be used once in a combination.

Players take turns finding such combinations. Upon finding one the active player may place his pawn on the board on the first or the third digit of the desired combination (never second). On any one area can only be placed one pawn. Therefore such area can be part of combination, but cannot be chosen to place a pawn on it.

The winner is the player who has found more combinations (indicated by the number of pawns on the board). If both players used the same number of pawns the winner is the player who has situated his pawns on areas which digits sum up to a higher number.
